name: EC2SecurityGroupRulePropertyType
description: The EC2 Security Group Rule is an embedded property of the AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup type.

properties.name: DestinationSecurityGroupId
properties.description: Specifies the GroupId of the destination Amazon VPC security group. (SecurityGroupEgress only)

properties.name: FromPort
properties.description: The start of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP type number. An ICMP type number of -1 indicates a wildcard (i.e., any ICMP type number).

properties.name: IpProtocol
properties.description: An IP protocol name or number. For valid values, go to the IpProtocol parameter in AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress

properties.name: SourceSecurityGroupId
properties.description: For VPC security groups only. Specifies the ID of the Amazon EC2 Security Group to allow access. You can use the Ref intrinsic function to refer to the logical ID of a security group defined in the same template. (SecurityGroupIngress only)

properties.name: SourceSecurityGroupName
properties.description: For non-VPC security groups only. Specifies the name of the Amazon EC2 Security Group to use for access. You can use the Ref intrinsic function to refer to the logical name of a security group that is defined in the same template. (SecurityGroupIngress only)

properties.name: SourceSecurityGroupOwnerId
properties.description: Specifies the AWS Account ID of the owner of the Amazon EC2 Security Group that is specified in the SourceSecurityGroupName property. (SecurityGroupIngress only)

properties.name: ToPort
properties.description: The end of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP code. An ICMP code of -1 indicates a wildcard (i.e., any ICMP code).
